paraphrased_statement: THE LINE is envisioned as a 170-kilometre, car-free linear city enclosed in a mirrored structure around 500 metres high and about 200 metres wide. Up to nine million residents are meant to live in vertically stacked neighbourhoods powered entirely by renewable energy, with daily needs reachable within a short walk and the surrounding desert largely preserved as a nature reserve.

source.source_title: THE LINE: a revolution in urban living

quoted_persons.name: Mohammed bin Salman
quoted_persons.role: Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia; initiator of NEOM and THE LINE

project_name: THE LINE, NEOM

originators.name: Mohammed bin Salman
originators.organization: Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, NEOM Company

related_research.title: Cognitive Cities: A journey to intelligent urbanism
related_research.notes: Frames cognitive cities as sentient, AI-driven urban systems; frequently linked to NEOM as a flagship example.

paraphrased_statement: A smart city is described as using real-time information to manage services, whereas a cognitive city is framed as a data-centric community that learns over time, builds memories and retrieves past experiences so it can act proactively and predictively, aiming to give residents back time and reduce everyday friction.

source.source_title: Cognitive City vs Smart City

project_name: NEOM Cognitive City and cognitive-city model

originators.name: Joseph Bradley
originators.role: Technology leader and public advocate of cognitive cities

related_research.title: Cognitive Cities: A journey to intelligent urbanism
related_research.notes: Defines cognitive cities as sentient urban systems that go beyond traditional smart-city infrastructure.

related_research.title: Towards Cognitive Cities: Advances in Cognitive Computing and its Application to Smart Cities
related_research.notes: Introduces the cognitive city concept and its main building blocks in an academic context.

related_research.title: Cognitive smart cities: Challenges and trending solutions
related_research.notes: Analyzes challenges and solution patterns for implementing cognitive smart cities.

paraphrased_statement: The MACeIP platform proposes a smart city architecture where dense IoT sensor networks, edge and cloud computing, and multimodal AI work together to form a responsive urban ecosystem. Interactive hubs, intelligent public asset management, pedestrian monitoring and a city-planning portal are combined so that the city can continuously sense conditions, analyse them and adapt services in near real time.

source.source_title: MACeIP: A Multimodal Ambient Context-enriched Intelligence Platform in Smart Cities

project_name: MACeIP: Multimodal Ambient Context-enriched Intelligence Platform

originators.name: Truong Thanh Hung Nguyen
originators.organization: Analytics Everywhere Lab, University of New Brunswick

originators.name: Phuc Truong Loc Nguyen
originators.organization: Analytics Everywhere Lab, University of New Brunswick

originators.organization: Analytics Everywhere Lab, University of New Brunswick

related_research.title: MACeIP: A Multimodal Ambient Context-enriched Intelligence Platform in Smart Cities
related_research.institution: Analytics Everywhere Lab, University of New Brunswick; RMIT University
related_research.notes: Presents MACeIP architecture, interactive hubs, sensor network and deployment in Canadian cities, focusing on Fredericton.

paraphrased_statement: A comprehensive review of artificial intelligence in smart cities argues that AI will underpin six core urban domains—governance, economy, mobility, environment, living and people. The vision is that data-driven AI systems will optimise transport, energy, environmental monitoring, public administration and citizen services, but that responsible deployment, inclusiveness and citizen engagement are crucial to avoid new barriers and risks.

source.source_title: Artificial Intelligence in Smart Cities—Applications, Barriers, and Future Directions: A Review

project_name: AI in Smart Cities literature review (Smart Cities journal)

institutions.name: Silesian University of Technology
institutions.department_or_unit: Department of Economics and Informatics, Faculty of Organization and Management

institutions.name: Silesian University of Technology
institutions.department_or_unit: Department of Production Engineering, Faculty of Organization and Management

related_research.title: Artificial Intelligence in Smart Cities—Applications, Barriers, and Future Directions: A Review
related_research.notes: Systematic review of AI applications and barriers in smart cities across six domains.

paraphrased_statement: An architectural critique of NEOM’s Cognitive City imagines a fully instrumented urban environment in which sensors, cameras and biometric systems feed a central AI operating system that optimizes transport, utilities, healthcare and daily services. The same vision, however, raises the prospect of an unprecedented surveillance infrastructure where every movement, transaction and interaction is tracked, potentially turning the city into a model of pervasive algorithmic control as much as an efficiency utopia.

source.source_title: NEOM's Cognitive City: Smart Utopia or Surveillance Dystopia?

quoted_persons.name: Maria Bogatinovska
quoted_persons.role: architectural designer; author of the essay

project_name: NEOM Cognitive City critical essay

related_research.title: NEOM's Cognitive City: Smart Utopia or Surveillance Dystopia?
related_research.notes: Architectural and ethical critique of NEOM’s cognitive-city vision, focusing on surveillance, data rights and human impacts.

paraphrased_statement: The Line is framed as the world’s first cognitive city that continuously predicts and reacts to residents’ needs using AI, sensors, data centers and autonomous systems, aiming to optimize services, cut emissions and deliver ultra-personalized urban life at scale.

source.source_title: The Line from NEOM
source.source_organization: Jacobs Urban Tech Hub, Cornell Tech

project_name: The Line cognitive city case study

originators.name: Yixuan Wang
originators.organization: Jacobs Urban Tech Hub, Cornell Tech

institutions.name: Jacobs Urban Tech Hub, Cornell Tech

related_research.title: NEOM’S The Line: The world’s first cognitive city
related_research.notes: Media feature describing The Line as a cognitive city that uses AI to predict and respond to residents’ needs.

related_research.title: Seven Years of Saudi Arabia’s NEOM Project: Prospects and Challenges
related_research.notes: Policy analysis discussing NEOM’s strategic ambitions, financing and geopolitical implications.

paraphrased_statement: Urban digital twins are envisioned as AI-augmented virtual replicas of cities where generative AI continuously expands and refines urban data, scenarios, and 3D models, enabling autonomous simulations, participatory planning, and human-AI co-design of future neighbourhoods.

source.source_title: Leveraging generative AI for urban digital twins: a scoping review on the autonomous generation of urban data, scenarios, designs, and 3D city models for smart city advancement

project_name: Generative AI for urban digital twins

related_research.title: Generative Artificial Intelligence in the Context of Urban Spaces
related_research.notes: Explores generative AI applications for urban space design and planning.

paraphrased_statement: Future cities are imagined as ecosystems where AI, blockchain and digital twins form an interdependent trinity: AI interprets real-time urban data, digital twins mirror and simulate the city, and blockchain anchors transactions and data flows in a trusted, decentralized ledger to support more responsive, transparent and inclusive urban governance.

source.source_title: The Urban Trinity: AI + Blockchain + Digital Twins = Future City?

project_name: Urban Trinity future city vision

paraphrased_statement: The Riyadh Digital Twin is presented as a large-scale, photorealistic urban twin that acts simultaneously as planning instrument, investment showcase and citizen engagement platform, allowing stakeholders to navigate future districts, test scenarios and discuss projects through immersive, game-engine-based interfaces.

source.source_title: From Vision to Reality: Using Digital Twin Technology in Urban Planning to Engage Citizens and Shape Future Cities

project_name: Riyadh Digital Twin

paraphrased_statement: The Line is interpreted as a radical linear prototype that compresses urban life into a 500-metre-high corridor promising zero emissions and AI-powered efficiency, while at the same time raising questions about surveillance, social stratification and ecological disruption in a sealed, top-down planned environment.

source.source_title: The Line as a Radical Urban Prototype for Smart and Disruptive City Planning

project_name: The Line radical prototype critique

paraphrased_statement: Dubai Live is envisioned as an AI-powered, real-time command hub that fuses digital twin representations of the city with predictive analytics to orchestrate urban operations, from infrastructure and inspections to waste management, as part of a broader ambition to govern the city through integrated, data-driven systems.

source.source_title: Dubai unveils 'Dubai Live': An AI-powered command hub to digitally govern the city in real time

project_name: Dubai Live AI city command hub

paraphrased_statement: Urban digital twins are combined with immersive metaverse environments so that planners, citizens and businesses can enter a shared, data-rich 3D version of the city, compare alternative futures and negotiate trade-offs before committing to physical change.

source.source_title: Urban digital twins and the metaverse

project_name: Urban Digital Twins & Metaverses

paraphrased_statement: Metaverse platforms and city-scale digital twins are framed as complementary layers: digital twins maintain accurate, analytical models of urban systems, while metaverse front-ends turn these models into explorable, social and experiential spaces for decision-making.

source.source_title: Metaverse and Digital Twins in the age of AI and XR

project_name: Metaverse and Digital Twins in the age of AI and XR

paraphrased_statement: The urban metaverse is described as an immersive 3D interface layer sitting on top of city data platforms and digital twins, where citizens, planners and officials meet as avatars to explore policies, simulate crises and collaboratively design street-level interventions.

source.source_title: Urban Metaverse: Applications, Challenges, and Research Opportunities

project_name: Urban Metaverse for immersive city governance

paraphrased_statement: The MetaOmniCity concept imagines an urban metaverse ecosystem in which multiple city digital twins and service platforms are integrated into a persistent virtual environment that people can access across devices, turning the city into a network of shared immersive experiences.

source.source_title: MetaOmniCity: An Urban Metaverse Ecosystem Conceptual Framework

project_name: MetaOmniCity urban metaverse ecosystem

paraphrased_statement: Large language model agents are proposed as natural-language interfaces to complex smart city systems, allowing officials, citizens and operators to ask questions, request analyses and trigger workflows in plain language, while specialised agents coordinate tasks in the background.

source.source_title: Large Language Model Agents for Smart City Management

project_name: LLM agents for smart city management

paraphrased_statement: Agentic urban AI is envisioned as a layer of software agents that autonomously monitor urban indicators, negotiate with one another and propose coordinated interventions, shifting cities from centrally programmed systems to self-organising, goal-seeking urban ecologies.

source.source_title: Agentic Urban AI: Towards Self-organising Cities

project_name: Agentic urban AI for self-organising cities

paraphrased_statement: Generative AI and multi-agent systems are used to simulate thousands of mobility scenarios in parallel, coordinating fleets, public transport and micro-mobility in near real time, with personalised route suggestions emerging from continuous citywide optimisation.

source.source_title: A Generative AI Based Multi-agent Framework for Smart Urban Mobility

project_name: GenAI-powered multi-agent smart urban mobility

paraphrased_statement: A new wave of smart city applications is envisioned as networks of specialised AI agents that collaboratively manage energy, mobility, public safety and disaster response, treating the city as an interconnected system rather than separate service silos.

source.source_title: The Next Generation of Multi-Agent Smart City Applications

project_name: Next generation multi-agent smart city applications

paraphrased_statement: Digital-first modelling is described as a planning paradigm in which city projects are first developed, tested and negotiated in immersive, data-rich virtual environments before construction, making the urban metaverse a primary workspace for planners, engineers and communities.

source.source_title: 2025 Trend Report: Digital-first Modelling and the Urban Metaverse

project_name: Digital-first modelling and the urban metaverse

paraphrased_statement: NEOM is described as a multi-layered AI-powered cognitive city project in which AI, digital twins, renewable energy and advanced mobility systems are tightly integrated to position the region as a global testbed for future urban living and innovation-driven economies.

source.source_title: NEOM: Saudi Arabia’s $500 Billion AI-powered Future City

project_name: NEOM AI-powered cognitive city overview
Masdar City net-zero living lab
paraphrased_statement: Masdar City is framed as a net-zero, testbed urban district where autonomous mobility, high-efficiency buildings and immersive public spaces demonstrate how a desert city can operate on renewable energy and advanced resource management.

source.source_title: Masdar City: pioneering a sustainable city of the future
source.source_organization: Masdar / Abu Dhabi Future Energy Company

quoted_persons.name: Sultan Ahmed Al Jaber
quoted_persons.role: Chairman of Masdar; UAE Minister of Industry and Advanced Technology

project_name: Toyota Woven City living laboratory
paraphrased_statement: Toyota's Woven City is envisioned as a fully connected prototype city at the base of Mount Fuji where autonomous vehicles, robotics, smart homes and immersive interfaces are tested in real life with a resident community.

source.source_title: Toyota Woven City project overview

quoted_persons.name: Akio Toyoda
quoted_persons.role: President of Toyota Motor Corporation at project announcement

project_name: Virtual Singapore national digital twin
paraphrased_statement: Virtual Singapore is described as a dynamic 3D digital twin platform that integrates geospatial, real-time and semantic data to support planning, risk assessment and participatory design across the entire city-state.

source.source_title: Virtual Singapore platform description

project_name: Metaverse Seoul public service platform
paraphrased_statement: Metaverse Seoul is presented as a virtual city hall and service layer where citizens can access public services, participate in consultations and join cultural events in an extended-reality version of Seoul.

source.source_title: Seoul Vision 2030 and Metaverse Seoul initiative

project_name: Telosa equitable future city
paraphrased_statement: Telosa is proposed as a new American city built on the principle of equitable land ownership, dense mixed-use neighborhoods and advanced sustainable infrastructure, framing urban development as a long-term social wealth project.

source.source_title: Telosa city vision

project_name: Songdo ubiquitous smart city district
paraphrased_statement: Songdo International Business District is portrayed as an early ubiquitous computing city where every building and street is connected to a central system, enabling energy monitoring, telepresence and integrated logistics services.

source.source_title: Songdo International Business District smart city overview

project_name: Xiong'an New Area digital twin planning
paraphrased_statement: Xiong'an New Area is framed as a 'city built in the cloud first', using full-scale digital twin models and AI-supported simulations to optimise infrastructure, transport and ecological restoration before physical construction.

source.source_title: Xiong'an New Area digital twin and planning approach
source.source_organization: People's Republic of China planning authorities

project_name: Dubai Metaverse Strategy 2030
paraphrased_statement: The Dubai Metaverse Strategy imagines the city as a hub for metaverse businesses, virtual workspaces and immersive tourism, projecting hundreds of thousands of jobs and a sizable contribution to the local economy.

source.source_title: Dubai Metaverse Strategy announcement

project_name: OXAGON NEOM industrial platform
paraphrased_statement: OXAGON is described as NEOM's floating industrial city where advanced manufacturing, logistics and port operations are orchestrated by AI, with digital twins and immersive control rooms managing real-time flows across sea and land.

source.source_title: OXAGON: redefining the industrial city

project_name: AlUla digital heritage and immersive landscape vision
paraphrased_statement: The AlUla masterplan positions the heritage landscape as an open-air museum, supported by digital twins, immersive storytelling and strict environmental protections to balance tourism growth with preservation.

source.source_title: Masterplan for AlUla: a living museum

project_name: Trojena NEOM mountain destination
paraphrased_statement: Trojena is framed as a year-round mountain destination within NEOM where high-altitude clusters for winter sports, wellness and astronomy are interlinked by digital infrastructure that orchestrates energy, mobility and visitor experiences.

source.source_title: Trojena | A luxury mountain destination in NEOM

quoted_persons.name: Mohammed bin Salman
quoted_persons.role: Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia; Chairman of NEOM Board of Directors

project_name: Sindalah NEOM luxury island
paraphrased_statement: Sindalah is envisioned as NEOM’s first physical gateway to the Red Sea, a luxury island where superyacht marinas, hotels and retail experiences are tightly choreographed with marine conservation and high-end digital guest services.

source.source_title: Sindalah: A luxury island in the Red Sea

quoted_persons.name: Mohammed bin Salman
quoted_persons.role: Crown Prince of Saudi Arabia; Chairman of the NEOM Board of Directors

project_name: Amaala regenerative wellness destination
paraphrased_statement: Amaala is positioned as a wellness-focused Red Sea destination where regenerative tourism, art and health resorts are embedded into a protected coastal landscape powered by renewables.

source.source_title: Amaala official site

project_name: The Red Sea regenerative tourism region
paraphrased_statement: The Red Sea destination is presented as a regenerative tourism region where luxury resorts, islands and marine parks are planned to restore coral reefs and habitats while creating a new economic engine for Saudi Arabia.

source.source_title: The Red Sea | Red Sea Global

project_name: OCEANIX Busan floating city prototype
paraphrased_statement: OCEANIX Busan is described as the world’s first prototype sustainable floating city that combines modular platforms, self-sufficient systems and climate-resilient urban design for coastal populations.

source.source_title: UN-Habitat and partners unveil OCEANIX Busan

project_name: Destination Earth planetary digital twin
paraphrased_statement: Destination Earth is framed as an EU flagship initiative to build a highly accurate digital twin of the entire Earth system for simulating extreme events, climate adaptation pathways and human-environment interactions.

source.source_title: Destination Earth initiative

project_name: Port of Rotterdam digital twin and autonomous shipping
paraphrased_statement: The Port of Rotterdam’s digital twin vision aims to create a real-time virtual copy of port operations that supports autonomous shipping, predictive maintenance and data-driven logistics decisions.

source.source_title: Smart infrastructure - Port of Rotterdam

project_name: Helsinki Energy and Climate Atlas 3D city model
paraphrased_statement: Helsinki’s Energy and Climate Atlas uses a semantic 3D city model to visualise building-level energy data and potential, turning the whole city into an interactive planning interface for achieving carbon neutrality.

source.source_title: Helsinki has published Energy and Climate Atlas on 3D City Model

project_name: Jurong Lake District future-ready hub
paraphrased_statement: Jurong Lake District is presented as Singapore’s next-generation business and innovation hub that integrates green mobility, climate-resilient design and data-driven management to decentralise growth away from the historic CBD.

source.source_title: Jurong Lake District Planning and Urban Design Guide

project_name: Yas Island immersive entertainment hub
paraphrased_statement: Yas Island is positioned as Abu Dhabi’s flagship entertainment district where theme parks, race circuits and upcoming large-scale indoor attractions create a dense cluster of location-based immersive experiences.

source.source_title: Yas Island official visitor site

originators.name: Miral Asset Management
originators.role: Master developer of Yas Island attractions

institutions.institution_name: Department of Culture and Tourism – Abu Dhabi

project_name: Digital Twin City governance paradigm (new infrastructure era)
paraphrased_statement: The monograph 'Digital Twin City (New Infrastructure Era Urban Smart Governance Study)' frames the digital twin city as a core vehicle for China's 'new infrastructure' strategy. It proposes that cities will be managed through high-fidelity virtual replicas that link information infrastructure, transport, buildings and energy systems into an integrated governance cockpit, closing loops between sensing, simulation and intervention.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: City officials supervise and approve interventions suggested by the twin-driven analytics.

project_name: Digital Twin City as virtual–real fusion gateway
paraphrased_statement: The book '数字孪生城市: 虚实融合开启智慧之门' ('Digital Twin City: Virtual–Real Fusion Opens the Gate to Smartness') conceptualises the digital twin city as a deep fusion of virtual models and physical infrastructure. It argues that this fusion enables a new generation of smart cities where planning, construction and operations are continuously informed by simulations and feedback loops between the twin and the real city.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市: 虚实融合开启智慧之门

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Urban professionals interact with the twin to test designs and policies before implementation.

project_name: China Digital Twin City white paper vision
paraphrased_statement: The 'Digital Twin City White Paper' by the China Academy of Information and Communications Technology describes digital twin cities as virtual replicas driven by new-generation information infrastructure. It outlines an architecture where cities build a unified spatiotemporal data base, connect heterogeneous sensors and use high-performance computing and graphics rendering to simulate and manage urban operations.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市白皮书
source.source_organization: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology (CAICT)

institutions.name: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Municipal departments use dashboards, reports and interactive tools built on top of the twin.

project_name: Digital twin city sensing–network–computing stack
paraphrased_statement: The CAICT white paper proposes a three-part stack for digital twin cities: terminal-side collection of static and dynamic urban data, high-bandwidth transmission via 5G, optical fibre and satellite systems, and powerful edge–cloud computing, particularly GPU-based rendering, to support real-time simulation and visualisation of city operations.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市白皮书
source.source_organization: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology (CAICT)

institutions.name: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Engineers and operators monitor and adjust city systems through the twin's real-time views.

project_name: Digital twin–driven emergency management city
paraphrased_statement: Within the Chinese digital twin city discourse, emergency management is framed as a key application field. A city-scale twin ingests sensor, weather and infrastructure data to simulate disasters, evaluate evacuation plans and coordinate multi-agency responses in real time, turning crisis management into a continuous, model-driven process.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市白皮书
source.source_organization: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology (CAICT)

institutions.name: China Academy of Information and Communications Technology

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Emergency commanders use the twin to explore scenarios, while final decisions remain with human teams.

project_name: Digital twin–enabled cultural and tourism corridors
paraphrased_statement: Case studies in the 'Digital Twin City (New Infrastructure Era Urban Smart Governance Study)' volume highlight how digital twins can support cultural and tourism development. Historic districts and scenic areas are modelled as high-fidelity 3D environments that combine visitor management, transport coordination and heritage protection into one integrated operational view.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Cultural and tourism authorities interpret twin outputs and design visitor strategies and narratives.

project_name: Digital twin city as education and training lab
paraphrased_statement: Chinese digital twin city literature proposes using city-scale twins as education and training laboratories, where universities and vocational schools teach urban planning, engineering and emergency response by letting students interact with realistic virtual replicas of their own cities.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Teachers and students co-create and explore scenarios inside the twin to understand complex urban systems.

project_name: Digital twin city governance evaluation paradigms
paraphrased_statement: The 'Digital Twin City' monograph outlines four development paradigms for digital twin cities and proposes a standardised evaluation index system for twin-enabled urban governance. Cities are meant to progress through stages from basic data integration to fully closed-loop, model-driven decision-making.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Policymakers interpret evaluation scores and decide which capabilities to build next.

project_name: Smart city digital twin IOC system
paraphrased_statement: A Chinese smart city design document titled 'Smart City Digital Twin IOC System' describes an urban operations centre where a digital twin acts as the core of an integrated management platform. It combines spatiotemporal data, sector applications and command functions into a unified cockpit for city leaders.

source.source_title: 智慧城市数字孪生IOC系统

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Operators in the IOC evaluate AI recommendations and coordinate responses across departments.

project_name: City Brain overall framework and main platforms
paraphrased_statement: A Chinese document on 'City Brain overall framework and main platforms' outlines an architecture in which a central urban brain connects data platforms, sector systems and service portals. The city is treated as a cyber-physical system where sensing, computing and actuation are orchestrated through the brain to support real-time governance.

source.source_title: 城市大脑总体框架和主要平台

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Officials and operators form the final decision layer above the city brain's automated analytics.

project_name: Resilient city via new urban infrastructure
paraphrased_statement: A 2024 opinion by the Central Committee and State Council on building resilient cities through new-type urban infrastructure sets out a national vision where digital, networked and intelligent infrastructure underpins urban safety and resilience. It calls for pervasive sensing, digitalisation of municipal systems and integrated operations platforms to make cities safer, more adaptive and faster to recover from shocks.

source.source_title: 中共中央办公厅 国务院办公厅关于推进新型城市基础设施建设打造韧性城市的意见
source.source_organization: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China; State Council

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Local governments use AI-supported platforms to monitor risk and coordinate mitigation and emergency actions.

project_name: City Information Model platform for resilient spatial planning
paraphrased_statement: The same policy document promotes building City Information Model (CIM) platforms that fuse 3D spatial data, planning information and operational data into a unified model. These platforms are meant to support risk assessment, spatial planning and disaster preparedness by making underground networks and built fabric visible and analysable.

source.source_title: 中共中央办公厅 国务院办公厅关于推进新型城市基础设施建设打造韧性城市的意见
source.source_organization: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China; State Council

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Planners and risk managers inspect CIM-based scenarios and adjust land use and infrastructure plans.

project_name: 5G C-V2X corridors as urban mobility twin layer
paraphrased_statement: A Chinese report on V2X car networking describes how cities such as Beijing, Shanghai, Guangzhou, Xiong'an and others are building pilot road sections where roadside sensing, edge computing and 5G C-V2X communication form an integrated platform for cooperative, connected and automated mobility.

source.source_title: 车联网专题报告：V2X车联网，5G新基建领头雁

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Traffic operators and vehicle manufacturers jointly interpret analytics and adjust control strategies.

project_name: Smart communities and digital families as urban resilience cells
paraphrased_statement: The resilient city policy envisions 'smart communities' and 'digital families' in which residential areas are equipped with IoT devices, smart lockers, safety monitoring and integrated property services. Homes become nodes in a wider safety and service network, supporting emergency response, health monitoring and more convenient everyday life.

source.source_title: 中共中央办公厅 国务院办公厅关于推进新型城市基础设施建设打造韧性城市的意见
source.source_organization: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China; State Council

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Residents and community managers receive alerts and can override or adjust automated responses.

project_name: Intelligent construction and BIM-based building lifecycle twin
paraphrased_statement: The resilient city opinion calls for integrating Building Information Modelling (BIM), smart construction equipment and industrialised building components into a unified digital process. Buildings are monitored throughout their lifecycle, from design and off-site production to construction and operation, supported by robots and 3D printing.

source.source_title: 中共中央办公厅 国务院办公厅关于推进新型城市基础设施建设打造韧性城市的意见
source.source_organization: Central Committee of the Communist Party of China; State Council

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Engineers supervise AI assessments of building health and adjust maintenance and construction plans.

project_name: Digital twin–assisted rural governance and smart villages
paraphrased_statement: Among its case studies, the 'Digital Twin City' monograph discusses Alibaba-led experiments in digital rural governance. Village and county administrations use integrated data platforms and digital representations of territory and services to coordinate agriculture, social services and local infrastructure.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Local officials and villagers jointly interpret data-driven insights to adjust local policies and investments.

project_name: Telemedicine and health networks as twin-linked urban service
paraphrased_statement: In its international case section, the 'Digital Twin City' book references Portugal's national telemedicine system as an example of digitally networked health services that can be linked into a wider urban and regional digital twin. Hospitals and clinics share data and virtualise parts of care delivery across territories.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Medical professionals remain central in diagnosis and treatment while using AI and digital twins as decision aids.

project_name: European smart cities as comparative twin city references
paraphrased_statement: The 'Digital Twin City' study includes Berlin and Amsterdam as reference cases for smart city development, emphasising how European cities explore data platforms, sensor networks and citizen services that resonate with China's emerging digital twin city agenda.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Chinese researchers and policymakers study foreign smart city platforms to inform domestic twin city designs.

project_name: Xiong'an blockchain platform and underground pipeline twin
paraphrased_statement: The 'Digital Twin City' book points to Xiong'an New Area's blockchain platform and Beijing sub-centre's underground pipeline management as examples of how infrastructure assets can be digitally modelled and governed. They anticipate a future where underground networks are maintained through shared ledgers and 3D twin models.

source.source_title: 数字孪生城市 (新基建时代城市智慧治理研究)

ai_layer.human_in_the_loop: Infrastructure managers rely on tamper-resistant records and spatial twins to plan maintenance and upgrades.
